column5: Supports Citizens to access their services safely and securely. Also supports Citizens in viewing and updating Patient information online.
Supports the local, regional and national reporting requirements of a General Practice. Report templates can be defined with search criteria and data can be interrogated at different levels.
Supports clinicians accessing information from a supported mobile device from any location.
This capability will allow Citizens to view, book and cancel appointments with the ability to add additional information, Appointments slots and their availability are configured by the Practice.
Supports the day to day recording, configuration, planning and scheduling of appointments in the Practice. Functionality also includes Practice reporting on appointments data.

Support decision making activities at the point of care by interacting with the Clinician via alerts to improve safety for the Patient. Functionality will also support auditing of decision making activity
Gives Citizens the ability to create, view and respond to communications with the Practice. Configured Practice Users and groups can be set up as suitable recipients of communications.
Functionality will cater for electronic requesting for Patients, for example Pathology and Radiology. Test results can be received, reviewed and stored against the Patient record.

Have the ability to store and retrieve documents of varying formats which may or may not relate to Patients. Supports the management of documentation which includes secure tracking, categorisation, and annotation.

Gives the ability to extract and send data to the calculating quality reporting service. Searching and reporting functionality will be provided to establish Patients included and excluded from the data extract.

Have the ability to record and review electronic referrals for Patients to other services. This will support recording referral information against the Patient Record and Patient based reporting on referrals
Be able to record information about the General Practice, staff and related organisations. Will also have the ability to record staff working availability and non-human resources (e.g. rooms)

Have the ability to record data, organise and search for Patient Records; with the ability to produce some Patient based reporting. Also have the ability to configure Patient and Proxy access to Citizen Services.

Be able to to record various types of Prescriptions and appliances and be able to review them for Patients. Supporting information required for prescribing will also be accessible which includes listed items to prescribe and drug tariff information.
Citizens can view, request and amend different types of prescription requests. Nominated pharmacies for electronic prescription requests can be chosen and amended.

Have the ability to record different types of consultations and specific data relating to consultations giving a more complete Patient record. Also supports the ability to create and share data entry forms which relate to consultations.
This capability will support the analysis of data locally for Practices. Data from other capabilities can be consumed and analysed to support clinical care and management of the Practice
This capability supports the conversion of paper based documentation into a digital format which will also give the ability for image enhancement to control the quality of the conversion.
Provide ability for the Patient to share data to support monitoring of Patients, remote care and communication. Functionality will also include alert triggers to actively manage the Patients care.

Provides functionality to able to extract information from documents for Practice use such as populating Patient data and associating Clinical Codes against the document when associating with Patient Records.
This capability will cater for Citizens being able to view relevant data from their Patient Record remotely. Access to Patient Record data will be configured by the Practice.

Supports days to day activities of the practice by defining, creating and allocating tasks and workflow items to Practice staff. Also allows for monitoring resource with reports, for example on workflow statuses and end dates for completion.
Standard to support the NHS111 CDA messages sent to GPs.

The Maternity and Digital Child Health programmes are planning to implement event-based, publish-subscribe messaging for Maternity and Child Health, e.g. immunisations and an electronic red book. NHS Digital intends to develop an event management service to support this implementation. An ISN is expected to be published in February 2019.
The Citizen Identity programme aims to replace per-supplier patient identities for online services with a verified, national, single identity per-citizen.
CDA is an XML-based HL7 standard for exchange of clinical information.
Pathology messaging involves the electronic transmission of results of pathology tests to GP systems in response to a test request placed with laboratories.

EPS allows prescribers (like GP Systems) to send prescriptions electronically to a dispenser (such as a pharmacy) of the patient's choice. This makes the prescribing and dispensing process more efficient and convenient for patients and staff. NHS Digital has an EPS homepage.
Systems that handle email need to meet secure email standards as detailed below. If a system needs to send a large volume of emails then application accounts are available at NHSMail.
This standard supports the collection of aggregated data generated by the issue of fit notes by GPs.
The NHS e-Referral Service (eRS) combines electronic booking with a choice of place, date and time for first hospital or clinic appointments

This page is blocked as there may be legal issues with publishing the EIS documents. BT retained copyright/IP and there has always been a view that we didn't have legal authority to publish. This has been raised to legal for resolution.

This is a national IT service and forms part of the national Spine architecture. It allows FGM risk information for girls under 18 to be to created, deleted, stored and shared with relevant NHS healthcare professionals across departmental, organisational and geographical boundaries within England, supporting effective early intervention and ongoing safeguarding of girls potentially at risk of FGM.
GP Connect aims to support better clinical care by opening up information and data held within GP Practice IT systems for use across health and social care.
The standard GP Data Set is a regular extraction of patient-related data from GP systems to NHS Digital
Not a current standard.
The GP2GP record transfer mechanism enables a patient's record to be electronically transferred directly and securely when they move from one practice to another.

The General Practice Extraction Service (GPES) is a service that securely collects information, with consent, from GP systems, and delivers it to approved organisations with the aim of directly improving patient care.

Suppliers of Clinical Systems to General Practice are required to provide integration capability to support three principal uses cases:

1. Bulk extraction of data
2. Practice-based interfaces to allow locally-deployed software applications to integrate with GP system application clients on the GP desktop
3. APIs to support patient-facing Internet-based services

Use cases 2 and 3 support both reading and writing of data.
The Interoperability Toolkit (ITK) is a set of common specifications, frameworks and implementation guides that support interoperability.
The Management Information (MI) Reporting Specification is a monthly collection of aggregated counts of data which cover a number of Capabilities.

column4: Messaging Exchange for Social Care and Health (MESH)
column5: The Message Exchange for Social Care and Health (MESH) is a centralised message transfer service provided by NHS Digital using the Spine Services Core infrastructure. This allows the service to benefit from the large-scale reliability of the Spine Services including its disaster recovery capabilities and established service support.

MIQUEST is a management information solution which allows practice users to define queries which are executed by system suppliers who then return the resulting data to the practice.\r\n\r\nMIQUEST is due to be decommissioned, which means that any existing implementations should be dealt with as per NHS Digital guidance and no new implementations should be created.

The National Authentication service is an implementation of OpenID Connect which replaces previous solutions (identity agent etc.) for authenticating NHS staff.\r\n\r\nAll new implementations must use the National Authentication service for authenticating staff, and any existing solutions must be transitioned to the new solution in line with NHS Digital's published guidance.

The National Record Locator Service (NRLS) aims to provide a national capability for locating and, ultimately, sharing patient records across health and care systems.\r\n\r\nFurther information is available at the NRLS web site.
This standard mandates NHS Digital's Internet First policy

National Health Application and Infrastructure Services (NHAIS) is a system which manages services, Patient registration and demographic details for England, Wales and Northern Ireland. NHAIS HA (Health Authority) / GP interfaces allow for the two-way exchange of data covering Registration changes and the processing of Items of Service claims.

The messaging implementation manual (MIM) defines HL7v3 message standards. Individual interfaces within this interoperability standard will refer to specific releases of the MIM where their messaging specifications are defined.
The Personal Demographics Service (PDS) is the national electronic database of NHS patient details such as name, address, date of birth and NHS Number (known as demographic information).

column4: Primary Care Clinical Terminology Usage Report
column5: This is a report to collect data from each system supplier on the frequency of use of clinical coded terms, both terminology (SNOMED CT, Read v2, CTV3) and local codes, recorded through their system for currently registered Patients over a 12 month period for all entries which are part of the GP record, aggregated across the selected Practices.

Reasonable Adjustments Flagging is a mechanism for patients with learning disabilities to have their need for reasonable adjustments to be flagged, and for the flag and the required adjustments themselves to be made available to people involved in their care via a national capability.

Some screening programmes use the Digital Diagnostics & Pathology Messaging standards to return results to GP systems. Variant NHS004 of the MEDRPT message was created to enable it to carry screening results.

The Summary Care Record (SCR) is an electronic record of important Patient information, created from GP medical records. It can be seen and used by authorised staff in other areas of the health and care system involved in the Patient's direct care.

Patients move between care settings and responsibility for them is handed over from one clinician to another. Transfer of care messaging ensures that the clinical context and information about the patient is transferred when this occurs
A weekly collection of data on all General Practice appointments from November 2017 through to October 2019.
Suppliers that provide systems will need to ensure that there are robust business continuity plans in place in the event of disaster recovery.
This standard ensures that Suppliers and buyers of GP IT Systems are carrying out effective clinical risk management relating to Patient safety.
Supports the safe and effective migration of data moving between GP IT Systems when a Practice moves from one Clinical System Supplier to another for part or all of their system .
Details data standards e.g. ISNs with which a supplier must be compliant when developing and implementing their systems, examples are fields lengths and formats.
Defines what training collateral and activities are expected of suppliers delivering capabilities into health and social care.
Supports best practices for infrastructure and hosting of systems. For example, ensuring that systems are cost effective, secure and energy efficient.
Supports confidentiality, availability (to authorised users when required), and accuracy of data processed by systems.
Defines the standards for the operation of GP IT Systems relating to all capabilities, for example the availability of data to a Citizen online.
Supports consistency of information that is entered into systems by defining data such as clinical terminology, organisational codes and drug database sets.
